Package org.Main

Class EditMap

java.lang.Object
org.Main.EditMap
public class EditMap
extends java.lang.Object
This class allows user to edit the map. Either it can be continent, countries or neighbours.

  • Method Details

    • editMap

      public void editMap​(java.lang.String p_file) throws java.lang.Exception
      This method allows user to edit the map. This method allows user to edit continent in a way that user can add the continent or remove the continent from the map. This method also allows user to edit countries in a way that user can add country or remove country from the map. It also allows user to edit neighbor as well in a way that user can add a neighbor to a country and can remove the country from it's neighboring country. After editing this method will ask the user to enter the file name in which user want to save the changes. After that it will ask the user to enter the validate map command so as before saving the map, it will be validated. Furthermore if the map is valid then it will get saved in that file name else it will say that map is not valid and changes will not saved. This method also checks if there is any wrong command enter by the user and tell the user that user entered the wrong command.
      Parameters:
      p_file - This file is the map in which user can do the editing.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - If there is some error or command entered by user is wrong, this will throws exception.

    • fileCreation

      public java.io.File fileCreation​(java.io.File p_file, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> p_cont_unique_key, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> p_cont_val, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> p_country_cont_key, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.ArrayList> p_country_neighbour, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.String> p_countrykey) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      This method is called after when user is done with the editing and map is validated. This method creates a file with the changes that user did and saves the file in the destination folder.
      Parameters:
      p_file - This is the file name in which map is created and saved.
      p_cont_unique_key - This is a data structure, basically a hashmap which denotes the country name as the key and their unique value as the value of the hashmap.
      p_cont_val - This is a data structure, basically a hashmap which denotes the continent names as the key and the control value of that continent as the value.
      p_country_cont_key - This is also a hashmap data structure which denotes the country name as its key and the continent's unique id to which the country belong in the map.
      p_country_neighbour - This hashmap data structure contains a string as the key and an arraylist as the value. The String denotes the country unique id and the arraylist contains the list of country's neighboring countries unique id.
      p_countrykey - This hashmap denotes the unique id of the country as the key and the country name as the value.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - If file is not present at the provided path it will throw exception.
